page.title: 08CATFIELD CHURCH
page.content: All Saints Church is situated on the outskirts of Catfield, near the First School. It is not supposed to have been the centre of an earlier settlement. It is mainly built of flint with some areas of additional brickwork. The churchyard is almost entirely surrounded by a flint and brick wall. The southern side of the church, nearest to the rectory, is cared for by the people of the village, but the northern side has been allowed to grow naturally.Inside the church is a screen with painted figures on it. On the walls above the nave are the faint outlines of medieval paintings. These used to be covered in whitewash. The tower now has six bells and there is a bell ringing practice on Friday nights. The present rector is Mr Smith.
